intro: Carallia confinis var. oxyodon, commonly known as the narrowleaf carallia, is a flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Violaceae and is characterized by its slender, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens and greenhouses.
